summary: var_args not portable for setTimeout and setInterval

comments.content:
(reposting as suggested from discuss)

Currently externs/window.js has setTimeout as

/**
 * @param {Function|string} callback
 * @param {number} delay
 * @param {...*} var_args
 * @return {number}
 * @see https://developer.mozilla.org/en/DOM/window.setTimeout
 */
function setTimeout(callback, delay, var_args) {}

setInterval is similar.

The var_args are passed in to the callback when it is called.  I've
tested this behavior under Chrome, Safari, and Firefox.  However,
Microsoft's documentation on the method has only an optional third
parameter indicating the language that the callback should be
interpreted as[1].  W3 Schools also documents this[2].

I don't have IE handy to test this behavior, but if it behaves
inconsistently I think we should remove the var_args for both
setTimeout and setInterval, so that folks at least get a warning.

1] http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms536753(VS.85).aspx
2] http://www.w3schools.com/jsref/met_win_settimeout.asp
i've confirmed that this is inconsistent with IE8.
The externs have been updated to use the common definition of setTimeout and setInterval.
